t: Amazon brand usage guidelines for 3-party display ads | Amazon Ads
s: In some situations, an advertiser may need to leverage the “Amazon” logo either alone (third-party usage) or in a lockup with their own logo (co-branding). Any use of the Amazon logo must be approved and reviewed in all cases. Please send request for approval with examples of proposed usage ...

t: How do Stores work with other Amazon Ads products?
Brand Stores: Create a brand page on Amazon for free | Amazon Ads
s: Creating and maintaining a Brand Store is free, and you do not need to advertise on Amazon to create a Brand Store. Once you create a Brand Store, you can showcase your products, brand story, and lifestyle content to engage shoppers.

t: List of Amazon brands - Wikipedia
s: November 26, 2024 - The private label Mama Bear sells baby wipes, baby food, diaper pail refills and baby laundry detergent. In 2018, the brand began selling newborn through size six diapers, which were previously offered by the Amazon Elements private brand before their removal from the site in 2014.

t: Requirements and tips for enrolling a brand in Amazon Brand Registry - Sell on Amazon
s: June 4, 2024 - Brand name discrepancies: Ensure that the brand name you provide during enrollment matches the trademark text exactly. Pay attention to spaces and symbols to prevent discrepancies. For example, if you register your trademark as “Buy with Prime” but your application shows “BuywithPrime,” ...

t: Sponsored Brands – Increase brand awareness | Amazon Ads
s: Sponsored ads on Amazon help build your brand and drive sales. Invest in long-term business growth by advertising your brand and products on Amazon.

t: Amazon is dropping dozens of in-house brands you didn’t even know it owned | The Verge
s: August 10, 2023 - The retail giant plans on cutting ... private-label brands across a variety of departments, most of which operate without Amazon branding, such as Solimo, Wag, and Mama Bear....

t: Amazon's new shopping feature lets you search for products even if they're not sold on Amazon
s: February 11, 2025 - We’re experimenting with helping customers find products from other brands’ sites when they search in the Amazon Shopping app.

t: Amazon Brand Protection Report 2023: Protecting against counterfeits
s: March 26, 2024 - In addition to the disposal of counterfeit products, in 2023, Amazon strengthened its cross-border anti-counterfeiting collaboration with brands and Chinese law enforcement, which led to more than 50 successful raid actions with more than 100 bad actors identified and detained for questioning, ...

t: Nike to resume selling directly on Amazon for first time since 2019
s: 1 week ago - Nike confirmed to CNBC that its shoes are returning to Amazon.

t: Amazon (company) - Wikipedia
s: 9 hours ago - Amazon sells many products under its own brand names, including phone chargers, batteries, and diaper wipes. The AmazonBasics brand was introduced in 2009, and now features hundreds of product lines, including smartphone cases, computer mice, batteries, dumbbells, and dog crates.

t: Amazon Puts Its Own “Brands” First Above Better-Rated Products – The Markup
s: The online giant gives a leg up to hundreds of house brand and exclusive products that most people don’t know are connected to Amazon

t: Sales collapse forces 'woke' mega-brand to make humiliating U-turn and relist on Amazon | Daily Mail Online

t: 8 Signs Your Brand is Out of Control on Amazon | Pattern

t: Amazon’s new 'Buy for Me' feature helps customers find and buy products from other brands’ sites
s: April 3, 2025 - New beta feature allows customers to use their Amazon Shopping app to complete purchases from other brand retailer websites if Amazon doesn’t sell the item directly.
